description: This function draws a grid of base ten blocks, which are used to visually represent numbers in the base-10 number system. The blocks are arranged in a grid with a maximum of two columns and three rows. This visualization helps students understand place value and number composition in a concrete, visual way.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Base Ten Blocks Grid
stimulus_type_specification.description: The draw_base_ten_blocks_grid function generates a grid of base ten blocks, which can be used to visually represent any number from 1 to 600. The function accepts an instance of the BaseTenBlockGridStimulus class as input, which specifies the number of blocks and their value. The function is constrained to a maximum of 6 blocks, arranged in a grid of 2 columns and 3 rows. This visualization is particularly useful in teaching concepts of place value and number composition in elementary mathematics.

details: stimulus: An instance of the BaseTenBlockGridStimulus class, which specifies the number of blocks and their value.
count: The number of blocks to be drawn. This controls the number of blocks displayed in the visualization.
block_value: The value of each block. This controls the size and type of each block in the visualization.
The number of blocks (count) must be between 1 and 6.
The value of each block (block_value) must be a positive integer.
The total value (count * block_value) must not exceed 600.
The function draws a grid of base ten blocks, with a maximum of 2 columns and 3 rows.
The size and type of each block is determined by the block_value input.
The number of blocks is determined by the count input.
